summary: This is an email chain from January 2021 between individuals, including an Assistant United States Attorney, discussing the search for saved emails related to Jeffrey Epstein and human trafficking. The emails indicate a lack of a complete email archive and reference a predecessor who may not have saved relevant communications.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Sender of the initial email inquiring about saved emails on the trafficking share drive related to Epstein; works at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

connections.description: Colleagues communicating via email about locating saved emails related to Epstein and trafficking.

events.title: Email inquiry about Epstein-related emails
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney emails colleagues to inquire about the location of saved emails related to Jeffrey Epstein and human trafficking on a shared drive.

locations: One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: An Assistant U.S. Attorney was actively searching for saved emails related to Jeffrey Epstein and human trafficking in January 2021.
The emails suggest that a predecessor (whose name is not fully provided) may not have saved relevant emails, indicating potential gaps in the record.
The correspondence references a 'trafficking share drive' as a repository for relevant emails, highlighting organized record-keeping efforts within the office.
